Posts.Content: We all know that positive margins are an adverse finding on the path report after prostate surgery but do they always result in BCR ? Your thoughts and literature if available to back up your answer please !
Posts.Title: When are positive margins insignificant or significant ?

Posts.Content: Since positive margins do not always result into BCR should you always radiate right away ( after surgery ) just because there were positive margins if so why and when ?

Posts.Content: My psa results post surgery ( 08-16-2012 ) has been <0.05 using the standard test , well my uro decided to switch to an ultrasensitive psa test without telling me and my last 3 psa tests came back at 0.030 low but stable. My uro is pushing for radiation , I am willing to wait because there is no evidence of rise or doubling time. I'm also thinking it may be benign tissue since my psa is low , stable and not rising . Should I RADIATE OR WAIT ? PLEASE HELP !
Posts.Title: Detectable but low and stable psa ! Radiate or wait ?

Posts.Content: The numbers are correct , 0.030 has been my numbers the last 3 psa tests .
Posts.Title: Detectable but low and stable psa ! Radiate or wait ?

Posts.Content: Yes sir it is less and that is why i am so confused as to why he is pushing secondary treatment at such a low level !
Posts.Title: Detectable but low and stable psa ! Radiate or wait ?

Posts.Content: The numbers are correct , 0.030 has been my numbers the last 3 psa tests .
Posts.Title: Detectable but low and stable psa ! Radiate or wait ?

Posts.Content: My numbers came back at 0.03 three times in a row , the uro said the sensitivity of the test can detect psa all the way down to .014 .
Posts.Title: Detectable but low and stable psa ! Radiate or wait ?

Posts.Content: You are correct it is causing a lot of anxiety I am 13 months post surgery my numbers are not bad at all I just don't understand his logic .

Posts.Content: Yes guys the decimal point is in the correct place 0.033 . That ultrasensitive psa test does cause a lot of anxiety my urologist actually called me to let me know about the increase from 0.030 to 0.040 in october and that we should watch it . The latest results came back at 0.033 greatful for that atleast it is not headed north !
Posts.Title: What caused decrease in psa ?

Posts.Content: Can nerve sparing cause psa to become detectable ( with ultra sensitve assay ) or rise after prostate surgery ?
Posts.Title: Nerve sparing and psa after rp !!!!!!

Posts.Content: With positive margins being an adverse finding on the path report should we radiate anyway regardless of favorable gleason grade at positive margin , length of positive margin or total gleason grade ?
Posts.Title: Should we radiate anyway when there are positive margins ?

Posts.Content: I guess inspite of the positive margins if all other findings are favorable it would be ok to just follow your psa closely say every 3 or six months just in case BCR does occur then you could get right to salvage radiation without any delay and not miss out on a second chance at curing the cancer !
Posts.Title: Should we radiate anyway when there are positive margins ?

Posts.Content: So Highlander what do they look at to determine when a second treatment is needed ? Doubling time of psa ? Is there a certain psa level to start secondary treatment ? I ask this because of my psa being DETECTABLE with the ultrasensitive psa test . Could it be benign tissue causing this result I did have nerve sparing surgery ? If it was cancer I would think my psa would be moving up quickly or doubling since i am right at 19 months post surgery !
Posts.Title: What is causing these fluctuating psa results ?

Posts.Content: Surgery August 16 2012 psa results <.05 , <.05 undetectable standard psa test then .028 , .030 , .030 , .040 , .033 , .038 detectable using the ultrasensitive psa test ! Is this up and down fluctuation a good enough reason to go ahead and start radiation ? All of the test were atleast 3 months apart !
Posts.Title: What is causing these fluctuating psa results ?

Posts.Content: Guys im 16 months post RP and I notice semen ( clear fluid ) after sexual intercourse eventhough my prostate and seminal vesicles were removed during RP ! Does this mean something was left behind ( prostate tissue etc. ) by the surgeon ? If so could this cause a slight increase in my psa results if i had sex before a psa test ? It really freaked me out to see i was still releasing this clear sticky fluid . Has anyone else experienced this ?
Posts.Title: Anyone still releasing semen after rp ?

Posts.Content: When prostate cancer has spread does the psa usually rise first or pain at the site of metastasis is felt before the rise ?
Posts.Title: Which comes first rise in psa or pain at site of spread ?

Posts.Content: Guys my last 3 psa results ( 2-3 months apart ) from the same lab were 0.042 , 0.047 and the last being 0.055 all from the same lab . I was curious about the minor increases so I changed labs the results came back at 0.040 also using an ultrasensitive assay this is a huge drop from 0.055 . I know it's better to use the same lab everytime but i'm happy it did come back lower my uro was talking salvage radiation . Has anyone else had an experince like this if so please share ?
Posts.Title: Changed labs big difference in ultra sensitive psa results !!!!

Posts.Content: At what psa level is salvage radiation advised ? Does insurance usually pay when a patient is not at the recurrence level ( 0.2 and rising ) ? Is salvage radiation advised with such low levels of psa even 0.055 to keep from overtreating a patient ?
Posts.Title: Changed labs big difference in ultra sensitive psa results !!!!

Posts.Content: With all of my psa results using the ultrasensitive assay from the same lab since april 2012 my uro said my doubling time was right at 18 months which is pretty encouraging at this point hopefully it stays that way ! I always keep in mind that on my path report there were positive margins ( grade 3 at margins ) and i did have nerve sparing surgery so there may be benign and cancerous tissue left behind . I will continue to montior my psa every 2-3 months and when and if i hit 0.1 and rising that will be my trigger point to start salvage radiation i know its a gamble guys but im trying to reduce the chances of overtreatment ! Does this approach seem reasonable /
Posts.Title: Changed labs big difference in ultra sensitive psa results !!!!

Posts.Content: Is this normal to have huge fluctuations like this with this type of test ? Eventhough it was a different lab i was expecting the same result ( 0.055 ) , a slight increase or slight decrease still happy to get that result for now !
Posts.Title: Changed labs big difference in ultra sensitive psa results !!!!

Posts.Content: Could you please give me the meaning of this finding from my final pathothology report (John Hopkins): The right anterior margin close to apex is positive ( 0.3cm ) where we cannot determine whether it is an area of intraprostatic incision or extraprostatic extension due to ambiguities of the histologic boundary of the prostate in this region; Gleason 3 + 3 at margin . Does this mean I have aggressive cancer?
Posts.Title: Need help interpreting this positive margin ! Please help !
